page.title: 06TRADE-A LOCAL FARM SHOP
page.content:
SHOPPING ON SATURDAY
ON SATURDAY MORNING I GO WITH MY MOTHER TO THE FARM SHOP. WE GO IN THE CAR AND PARK OUTSIDE THE SHOP IN THE DRIVE. THE SHOP IS LIKE A GARAGE WITH ROWS OF SHELVES MADE OUT OF BOXES. FRESH VEGETABLES AND FRUIT ARE PUT ON THE BOXES WITH THE PRICES WRITTEN ON BITS OF CARDBOARD. THE FARMER GROWS MOST OF THE FRUIT AND VEGETABLES HIMSELF. THEY ARE CHEAPER THAN THE ONES IN THE SUPERMARKETS AND SOMETIMES THEY HAVE ONLY BEEN PICKED HALF AN HOUR BEFORE WE BUY THEM. MY MOTHER SHOPS AT THE FARM BECAUSE IT IS CONVENIENT, CHEAPER AND GOOD QUALITY. THERE ARE NEW LAID EGGS FOR SALE. THE EGGS ARE STACKED IN TRAYS AND SOME STILL HAVE STRAW ON THEM FROM THE HEN HOUSE. YOU CAN ALSO SEE A WHITE GOAT WHICH IS KEPT IN A PADDOCK.
